96863D5E7FD94D84A3C7380DC617258C.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to,
and responding to texts.

FF776C28969C42B180351C9038347A9B.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general
action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

2DC44C8CF21E4414AFBA6AD4A77CC774.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at
school that are colorful).

A2BECD62B7CB49DC8BB29B08079523C2.description:
Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by
relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

24E57C1B325C41E89160466DDD587882.description:
Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of
concepts the categories represent.

229C71C263E741419758F558BDA5D8EC.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in
word meanings.

FE737127DFF8435A8A9084088AEEADD9.description:
Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-,
pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

386EE75CF0854C239E876B10A6207FCD.description:
Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g.,
knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb duck)

9984D8C64D5D4D51A5BAFC9A1E8BE4E1.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and
phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

40870931742544E6B8D89EBF7E3321F5.description:
Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter
relationships.

CD61D6F3D77C4901B324C73676CE3382.description:
Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds
(phonemes).

911A55A0196E40FF8914EA9A6CE17AE7.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

644A743BC5FA437288858F405098DDAB.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

CF3CCF222FBF493BB70CB89199AA6D01.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

807E1B76B06B4752A58148182F644A15.description:
Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off,
for, of, by, with).

8DFCDB74841C4C528FF830FFD477C882.description:
Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where,
when, why, how).

3245B3196CF94719A6DC00CDE333FA54.description:
Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish,
wishes).

52BEDC7A8D804C60BBCEAB41341D91F4.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

24249D0B3B9E4126978BE3A29D6869ED.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.

93DA8E73D3194FABB2311F68AC27D55F.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage
when writing or speaking

387C018B4F4040668305BB142449406E.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

628CC4D50BEA495887BF6AA446AAB7F2.description:
Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide
additional detail.

D8AF78A08B1C43C6B9C516C8E4EB28A5.description:
Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and
support, provide additional detail.

81A074336F144E999C4D479D8B560322.description:
Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify
something that is not understood.

04675BC3FC4941C3B5F3CBD2EB34BCC6.description:
Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or
through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and
requesting clarification if something is not understood.

4B54D99A3D8441ECA269211DDFD910E4.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

16A0BDD9321C4E01BB62CEA5F6AE4EF3.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking
turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

6AF8822C3ABC47538FF4350DCC48860C.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten
topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

F2382C301AF744618C77340916F22A58.description:
With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or
gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

592747CC6F604DB59528DC04FFE06BCF.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books
by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

4FEB1F3032B644C9970E5A7691066E41.description:
Research to Build and
Present Knowledge

D44BF1AF27A64ECEB75026E2EC1C3F5B.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce
and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

CE1FBC91EB124F1487DF65A00524A6FA.description:
With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from
peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

509C4660438646CAAA10A359E6BDF27D.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, pre-writing, and writing to narrate a single
event or several loosely linked events, tell about events in the order in which they
occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

69CD194580A44323B2694E93E5B344BD.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, pre-writing, and writing to compose
informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and
supply some information about the topic.

B022A973C26848BA89F2D54D66A595AF.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, pre-writing, and writing to compose opinion
pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing
about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite
book is…).

FAC16099CAE14F0685427F935A4457EF.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

62CF1853E9D94D498A508EFCC3EBE6BE.description:
Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the
letters that differ.

CB712A9EE3744C0E98A895179381D974.description:
Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is,
are, do, does).

A910643E7C734B778DA26C13D294ADDA.description:
Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for
the five major vowels.

66BCBD75E9974A0FA865700B87E9C6A2.description:
Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by
producing the primary or many of the most frequent sounds for each
consonant.

52399594904449729CCEBC0AF1B70B98.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

A0237253D8984D31A1D614E77AF0797F.description:
Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words
to make new words.

00BA86C7FD064CBCBFA528EF6A99472E.description:
Isolate and pronounce the initial sound, medial vowel, and final sounds
(phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant – vowel – consonant, or CVC)
words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

479C3EA8C94E43A38F99EB73E1E74A3B.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

2F87BDF296CD4F2BAB24946763532DB1.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

AB126BAB48BC4171A96243DD8DE21C86.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes)

27F92E8C6470465D8459E09F03FEF358.description: With support and tools, recognize a letter’s position in the alphabet.

937ADD64277E4CE2A1498C75C9E60106.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

C3CAAE56CB0A476D8550A99630037604.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

5C8B842E235D4A8D994AF08B295101E4.description:
Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific
sequences of letters.

87739714B22640E1AD9FA517BEE05234.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

BC938FAC13ED44618CEAC69A5CB5D36E.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

F8C0E3C8AFC74FFEA01A523B5AC3D747.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

C751387AED2D401CB4D7E5CD2A7F00EF.description:
Range of Reading and
Level of Text Complexity

49DD9D2B482A434D8CAE9B99E572522F.description:
With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between
two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

13FAB75383B8498FAA5AA9610B02D0A6.description:
With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points
in a text.

DFF87C829C1B4DF68D6125A3703391EB.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the
text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an
illustration depicts).

20889B6EDE0B47D6A5C18D32555E8A43.description:
Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting
the ideas or information in a text.

19462975113F45D1BF3A72AB4B911637.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book

6E64835A22AC4A82A2A1761F60B99D1E.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a
text.

E2E73AE7DD7043F9BD3C8154A6204942.description:
With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals,
events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

DDC93A197BF6447B83B937EE84F028DB.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

901E7B6A66B44967A8C7E5C28CE92971.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

E1F0E234B73149EE9B961ACCCD57F084.description:
Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding using
comprehension strategies.

FCB626199F384A12A00BA0DF9C3E6329.description:
Range of Reading and
Level of Text Complexity

522EF75F9A1C4BCDB99B4214B1F8B346.description:
With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences
of characters in familiar stories.

3AE68CEA60224C21A506E0BF75512C95.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the
story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

889E7F0AE0544F6C9345F6B19431D97B.description:
With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define
the role of each in telling the story.

0D23585353CD47DC81883DA66EC92A7D.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

A49B5ED6EA7342BAAC7E82508CB1076A.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

D9ED9A244FE948EFAC71F2418AD2BFF2.description:
With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and sequence of major
events in a story.

E8B96463FFC04026A1AAEC6D83C64060.description:
With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including main ideas and key
details.

A238C4084AF44BE3A47C3D6948B5EF93.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
